reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were at Sandals Regency from March 5 to March 13, and this was our third Sandals stay, having stayed twice before in Jamaica, first at Whitehouse and then the Royal Caribbean. The staff at all three Sandals have been incredible, so friendly and helpful, but I think overall the staff here was the best. Tasha at the swim up bar at the main pool made the BEST Dirty Bananas and was always smiling and pleasant. The resort is gorgeous with actually 2 sections to it, one down by the large pool which is fun and very active, and the other quieter area is up the hill on the bluffs with the beautiful views and sunsets. The restaurants were all great, although I think Piton's was our favorite. Our room was nice, clean, with an ocean view in the main building, but we had been spoiled at Royal Caribbean last year when they upgraded us to the River Suites. The only complaint we had was there weren't enough umbrellas at the pool if you wanted to escape the sun (and it was very hot every day with an ongoing drought). People would go down to the pool by 6:30 a.m. to reserve a good spot with an umbrella, and some days it was hard to find a chair anywhere. The beach was rough with the red flag for many days, so we only spent 1 or 2 days there. Overall though, the resort is beautiful with a wonderful staff, and I would definitely recommend it, and we may try Sandals in Antigua next year. Many thanks to Amy at Dream Makers Vacations for the awesome service and efficiency in helping us plan our vacation.
reviews.title: Great, relaxing vacation in a gorgeous place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: There is very little to complain about at this resort and the minor ones that I can think of (refrigerator not very cold, one person at front desk not all that helpful, departure plans not fully on track) in no way negatively affected any of our experiences. All the staff (from those who cleaned the rooms to the managers) were very attentive and seemed to go out of their way to be personable, friendly, and make you feel welcomed/special (not an easy feat with so many couples celebrating momentous times in their lives or to be able to do ALL day long at your JOB). Hats off to them all, but a few deserve an extra "shout out" : To George at the pool who was never seen without a smile, heard without a compliment/nice word, or too busy to offer to do extra tasks! THANK YOU for making all ten of us feel like we were special and worth going the extra mile for. To be noted- George was seen making all who were in his path feel this way- Kudos to him!! To: Ana-Faye our renewal of vows coordinator who has a beautiful smile, sweet personality, and who never seemed to miss a beat when changes in our schedule conflicted with the plans she had. She was attentive to detail and just rolled with what most of us would find an inconvenience. THANKS for making me feel as though we were friends and for such a special day! TO: Chris and Jena our photographers. What patience (for an "unruly" bunch) and true undertsanding of what makes for beautiful pictures. We really made you work hard (not easy to teach 10 people to follow directions) with no signs of exasperation ; ). We have unbelievable pictures that are highly complimeted by all who see them- THANX so much! Lastly, to the lady and gentleman (I did not get their names) in the jewelry store at the resort. I have a gorgeous diamond ring- that was sized and ready in less than 24 hours. They were overly kind and great to work with- even if for a short time.
reviews.title: A lasting great memory for a lifetime!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have left out a detailed account of the resort as many other reveiws on this site explain them very well. All our rooms were very clean, the staff treated us all with high regard, the food was great at all restaurants, loved the drinks/pool, and you could be as much a part of the action/as solitary as you would like. I will say that the differences from our first stay there 10 years ago (when we stayed in a room on the bluff) to this stay (with various levels of room on the resort, but not the butler serviced ones) were very few. The weddingmoon 10 years ago included everything, but this time what was included back then are now considered "extras" and needed to be paid for if wanted. Although we did not stay in the rooms with extras (specialty reservations, butler service, etc) , we in no way felt like we missed out on anything thanx to the staff/amenities at the resort. Also, the addition of the Street Party- it was a blast! Great food, entertainment and fun!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent our honeymoon at this resort. We stayed a total of 5 nights and we enjoyed every minute of it. We never expected to be treated as celebrities since we too were Caribbean people. We arrived at the resort early (around 11am) and was expected to be checked in at the regular time (2-3pm), but this was not the case. Upon arrival we were taken directly to the Pavilion restaurant to have lunch, the concierge manager was so considerate, he wanted us to have lunch before we checked-in. Once we were finished with lunch our room was upgraded and we were allowed to check in early. The staff was so friendly and helpful. We met one of the playmakers (member of staff) and we hit it off. He showed us around the resort and gave us some useful tips for getting around the resort. The food was delicious. We couldn't have asked for a better honeymoon.
reviews.title: Best Honeymoon Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010
reviews.text: Went in mid July 2010 with my wife, her parents and mine, and was overall very satisfied. From the start the ride from the main airport is long and winding so bring motion sickness pills if you need to but there was a lot to see as you take go. Our driver was able to answer some basic questions about the island and made a stop for a photo op. 2 of the couples stayed in the concierge suites and one stayed in a butler suite(they loved there butler). Check in was easy and the champagne and cookies were nice. Overall the resort grounds are amazing but if you look closely there are some flaws. The concierge folks were a little slow for some things but warp speed for others, 45 minutes for ice maybe 2 minutes for champagne. We tried all the restaurants at our resort and the Pier and halcyon and it was all great. Kimonos was my favorite. The piano bar was fun when it was a piano bar, late night a DJ comes in and it gets loud, can’t order a drink loud. Golf was enjoyable and easy to get a tee time(tip your caddie), and the girls enjoyed the spa. The “In each others hands” package was fun.

reviews.text: We booked the Penthouse Romeo & Juliet One Bedroom Suite, which is located on the bluff on the top floor of the 4-story building overlooking the villas below. I will say that if you leave food out, the ants will find you, so best to avoid that by always leaving any food outside for the staff to collect. It did not happen to us, but the couple in the room next door reported issues, but we noticed they were eating a LOT of room service since she was pregnant and sometimes stayed in her room a lot.

reviews.title: Loved the Sandals Regency St. Lucia
reviews.text: I can’t say enough about Dean. He is a great manager, and he is the person you would want to get in touch with if you have any issues. When we first got there our room was noisy because they were working on the roof. Dean happened to be at the front desk when we went to complain and he moved us to another room asap. The new room didn’t have an iron, suitcase racks or closet doors. We were told there were no suitcase racks by the front desk, and after we complained to Dean we have 4 in our room. I thought there were none available? Anyway, we came back from dinner to Champagne on ice and chocolate covered fruit which I thought was a very nice touch. Every time we saw Dean around the hotel he always stopped us and asked how everything was. We had a couple of other minor issues like no towels at the pool; bathroom blew a fuse and so on. We let Dean know, and he apologized for the inconveniences. One night he saw us going to dinner and he walked us to the restaurant. When we came back to our room there was champagne on ice, rose peddles all over the place and candles lit all over the room…very romantic! I had to come clean and tell my wife that I didn’t plan it. Dean also ended up arranging a private ride to the airport for us since he wasn’t able to upgrade our room due to the fact that they were at full capacity. Dean did what a real good manager should do, and made it seem like he really cared and wanted us to leave happy.

reviews.title: Wonderful Vacation
reviews.text: Food:

reviews.title: This IS the Caribbean... Would go back in a heartbeat and take the butler home !
reviews.text: Great! I work in New York, and I am taken to nice restaurants often for business. I love food, and I was really nervous about how my meals were going to be after reading a lot of reviews that the food was mediocre at best. We had steaks, baby lamb chops, veal and seafood amongst other very nice dishes. The Pavilion (buffet) is convenient for breakfast but the food is not good at all. I think this is expected from an outdoor buffet in the Caribbean. Armondos is the Italian restaurant up by the Bluff Pool. The food here is great. Big portions, nice salad bar, great service and the pasta dishes are out of this world. The ribs down at Arizona are great, and they have a good nacho bar that you can use anytime of the day, warning this could be real dangerous! LaToc and The Pitons had very good food as well. The Japanese place was good, but don’t expect Hibachi that you get here in the states. That being said, I thought the Japenese food was better than I thought it would be. The!

reviews.title: Not that great ... just an average experience
reviews.text: We stayed at Sandals for our honeymoon from Oct. 16-26. If you're looking for a 5-star resort, think again. I give Sandals marketing department an A+ plus for making you think you're staying in paradise, when it's just an average resort.

reviews.title: It could have been worse
reviews.text: We booked a honeymoon suite with ocean view (at $600 per night). The room was a disaster ... dirty, old, outdated (I have pictures to prove it). We toughed it out for four days and then asked to be moved to the main building (which by the way is newly renovated with a flat screen TV, jacuzzi tub, and modern amenities. ADVICE: DO NOT PAY FOR AN UPGRADED ROOM. IT IS NOT WORTH IT, DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY. The cheaper rooms are just as good and are closer to the pool and most restaurants.

reviews.title: Amazing time at Sandals
reviews.text: The management at the resort is not very quick to fix problems. They're probably so used to people complaining that they don't go out of their way to make to satisfy you. Don't get me wrong, they are very friendly, but they need additional training in customer service. The general manager walks around like his you-know-what doesn't stink. I can give you many more detailed examples, but it will take too long.

reviews.title: Great Vacatiion
reviews.text: After our fantastic experience at Crystals, we may have been tainted because we found the Regency to just be "okay". We found that you could find privacy and romance at Sandals if you wanted it, but it meant not hanging out in the main parts of the resort. The main pool was crowded and noisy, like an all-day frat party. We do our fair share of partying since we live in Manhattan and enjoy the bars and nightlife at least on a weekly basis, but for our honeymoon we were looking for something more private and relaxing. There was a quiet pool on the "bluffs" where we spent most of our time (if this pool hadn't been there, we would have been at a loss!). There were lots of activities to participate in at the resort -- pool volleyball, drinking at the pool bar, ping pong and pool, various contests organized by the staff, tennis with an onsite tennis pro, spa, golf, just lazing on the beach, water sports... you name it. There were also a lot of offsite tours that you could take advantage of.
